title: Lamenting Beacon Hill’s power over cities, Wu responds to rejection of her tax plan
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Politics "This is not just Boston, this is a frustration that I know and hear from communities everywhere," Mayor Michelle Wu said.
Boston Mayor Michelle Wu.

Danielle Parhizkaran / The Boston Globe, File Last week, the Massachusetts Senate voted to reject Boston Mayor Michelle Wu’s plan to temporarily shift more of the city’s property tax burden onto commercial properties.

title: Boston meteorologists offer early look at track of ‘major winter storm’
author: Heather Alterisio
bullets: Weather Plus: Here's what they're saying about this week's "BITTER COLD.
" ShareSend this article to your social connections.

National Weather Service: ‘Southern New England will experience an extended period of dangerously cold temperatures and wind chills’ Southern New England will experience an extended period of dangerously cold temperatures and wind chills starting Friday night and continuing into early next week.

title: BPD seeks public’s help to identify suspect in South Boston aggravated assault

bullets: Crime The incident happened earlier this month on West Broadway.
Police are looking to identify this suspect in relation to a Jan.
11 assault in South Boston.

title: Revolution announce signing of winger Griffin Yow
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: New England Revolution “Griffin has strong instinctive abilities on the attacking end that complement his speed and abilities with the ball.
" Griffin Yow in Revolution preseason practice.

Via New England Revolution By Hayden Bird January 20, 2026 | 1:46 PM 2 minutes to read The Revolution continued an offseason trend, adding another younger player with experience under the team’s new head coach.

title: New lottery coming to Mass. will award $1 million a year for life
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Local News The new game launches Sunday, Feb.
22, replacing Lucky for Life.

Photo illustration by Maura Intemann/Globe staff; Images from Massachusetts State Lottery/Adobe A new national draw game, called Millionaire for Life, is launching next month in Massachusetts and 30 other jurisdictions, giving players a chance to win the $1 million-a-year-for-life jackpot every day.

bullets: Travel Couples can stay in a luxe treehouse with a gas fireplace.
Twin Farms in Barnard, Vermont.
By Kristi Palma January 20, 2026 | 12:16 PM 1 minute to read An adults-only resort in Vermont is a perfect getaway for couples this Valentine’s Day, according to Yahoo Travel.

title: 19-year-old killed in snowy Maine crash
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Local News Joamaliz Orozco was driving a Subaru Impreza that reportedly crashed into a guardrail Saturday afternoon, according to police.
By Abby Patkin January 20, 2026 | 11:35 AM 1 minute to read A 19-year-old Connecticut woman died Saturday following a crash on a snowy Maine highway, authorities said.
Maine State Police identified the teen as Joamaliz Orozco, an East Hartford resident.

title: Joe Mazzulla produced another humorous quote when asked about Jayson Tatum’s return timeline
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Morning Sports Update "I failed medical school.
" Joe Mazzulla during the Celtics' 2025-26 season.

Danielle Parhizkaran/Globe Staff By Hayden Bird January 20, 2026 | 11:17 AM 3 minutes to read Joe Mazzulla’s candid response about Jayson Tatum: Despite reshaping the team’s roster amid a long-term Jayson Tatum injury — and a scramble to cut salary in the past offseason — the Celtics are where they normally are: right in contention.
